idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.0.0.535

descript.abstract: ArcGIS polygon shapefile of the boundaries of the Marbled Murrelet Analysis Areas used in the NWFP Effectiveness Monitoring efforts. This dataset also includes the boundaries of the Marbled Murrelet Zones (1 & 2), first developed for FEMAT in 1993 (from the coverage mmz_527, aka the shapefile mmz_2004). The Analysis Area breaks are made primarily along hydrologic unit (HUC) boundaries, with the idea that the birds generally use corridors through the forest (often stream channels) when traveling between the coast and their nesting habitat. This would imply that birds remain within hydrologic drainages for the most part, rather than crossing over ridges to enter other drainages. This was the general rule of thumb used when developing these analysis areas, although the monitoring team is aware that, in certain parts of the Murrelet's range, the birds have been known to cross over ridge tops as well as use human-made corridors, such as road and utility cuts, which do not remain within HUC boundaries.
descript.purpose:
These Analysis Areas were developed for the sole purpose of attempting to show the relationship between at-sea bird population estimates and the estimated amount of available nesting habitat inland. Since population surveys are performed within Marbled Murrelet Conservation Zones (1-5), as described by the 1997 Recovery Plan (USFWS/Region 1), the Analysis Areas are meant to approximate the inland extent of those Conservation Zones to include the entire range of the Marbled Murrelet within Washington, Oregon and California.
WARNING: These Analysis Areas are NOT intended to be used for any regulatory or jurisdictional purposes. As stated above, they are ONLY to be used by the NWFP Effectiveness Monitoring team in their efforts to draw some conclusions about the relationship between available nesting habitat and bird populations.

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.2.2.3552

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

edom.edomvd: Analygous to FEMAT (1993) Murrelet Conservation Zones, but extended inland
Inland zones defining Murrelet range as per FEMAT

procstep.procdesc: Starting with the Marbled Murrelet Zones boundary coverage (mmz_527), breaks were added along hydrologic unit (HUC) boundaries using the reohucv13 dataset. Breaks between at-sea (population survey) zones were used (z23_psu and z45_psu datasets) to refine inland breaks near the coast. Analysis Area breaks varied from straight-forward interpretation of HUCs: a) at coastline where smaller unit HUC boundaries were used when stream flow was directed into one or the other at-sea zone (determine by PSU boundaries); or b) near outer (eastern) reaches of Murrelet range where following HUCs would lead to unreasonable distances (professional opinions) for the birds to travel to the coast. In the former case, HUCs were either split (as with a catchment along the MMAA 1-2 break), or placed entirely in an adjacent MMAA (as with a subwatershed along the MMAA 3-4 break). In the latter cases, either a straight line was drawn to the eastern range boundary to complete the MMAA polygon (see MMAA 1-2 break), or all or part of a subbasin was placed in an adjacent MMAA (see MMAA 3-4 and 4-5 breaks).

citeinfo.title: Hydrologic Unit Boundaries for Oregon, Washington and California
